body.name: Amy Snow: A Novel
body.description: Winner of the UK's Richard & Judy Search for a Bestseller Competition, this pause-resistant debut novel follows an orphan whose late, beloved best friend bequeaths her a treasure hunt that leads her all over Victorian England and finally to the one secret her friend never shared. It is 1831 when eight-year-old Aurelia Vennaway finds a naked baby girl abandoned in the snow on the grounds of her aristocratic family's magnificent mansion. Her parents are horrified that she has brought a bastard foundling into the house, but Aurelia convinces them to keep the baby, whom she names Amy Snow. Amy is brought up as a second-class citizen, despised by the Vennaways, but she and Aurelia are as close as sisters. When Aurelia dies at the age of 23, she leaves Amy 10 pounds, and the Vennaways immediately banish Amy from their home. But Aurelia left her much more. Amy soon receives a packet that contains a rich inheritance and a letter from Aurelia revealing she had kept secrets from Amy, secrets that she wants Amy to know. From the grave she sends Amy on a treasure hunt from one end of England to the other - a treasure hunt that only Amy can follow. Ultimately, a life-changing discovery awaits...if only Amy can unlock the secret. In the end Amy escapes the Vennaways, finds true love, and learns her dearest friend's secret - a secret that she will protect for the rest of her life. An abandoned baby, a treasure hunt, a secret. As Amy sets forth on her quest, listeners will be swept away by this engrossing gem of a novel - the wonderful debut by newcomer Tracy Rees. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What an adventure this took me on. Its the best book I have read in a while. I didn't want it to end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wonderfully told story of growing up in a difficult household ...
reviews.reviewText: Wonderfully told story of growing up in a difficult household with strict parental ideals of what's proper and who should or shouldn't be allowed to associate with you because of financial status. Amy starts out life seeing it through the eyes of the kitchen help and gradually her world opens upand she sees more through the eyes of young heiress of the household. Amy learns to trust the heiress, gets schooled with her, and learns Almosteverything about her. When the heiress dies young, Amy is led on a secret adventure set up via letters sent to her by the heiress before she died. It's up to Amy whether to follow all the leads or not and just "really live" on her own . The book moves you right along on the adventures of both girls. I kept wondering if Amy would discover who her parents were but she found somebody to love her and that's all that mattered in the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Clever, mysterious, great character development of characters one cares about...just loved it! I have read it twice, and suggested it for my book club. We read it this month and discussing it tomorrow. Can’t wait!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to love this book. The reviews are awesome and then the bestseller contest award clinched it. The author shows promise, but to me, the constant back and forth from Aurelia’s past to the present was exhaustively tedious.I fast forwarded through the entire book.To the author’s credit, the plot was unique and it piqued my curiosity. I will still shop for Tracy Rees titles in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Queen Victoria's era story
reviews.reviewText: Loved this book! It's a story of a little baby abandoned in the snow by a manor estate. The baby is found by the owner's young daughter, Aurelia. She keeps Amy (the baby) safe and out of the way as her mother doesn't wish to ever see the child. Amy later becomes not only her maid, but almost like a sister to Aurelia. Aurelia is quite the free-spirit for her era and travels quite a bit. However, in her most recent travels, Amy must stay home. Aurelia has been told she has a condition that will end her life soon. Amy is grief-stricken and after Aurelia's death is forced from the only home she knows. However, Amy discovers that she is not alone and her travels are planned by Aurelia even after her death. Following the adventures of Amy and seeing how she solved riddles left by Aurelia is a page-turner. Good read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Too Good to be a Beach Book--you won't want to go in the water!
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful book, and it is difficult to believe it is the first book written by the author. An English teacher would say it is about a quest, which it is, but it is also about relationships, trust, belief in your friends, and many other things. I passed my copy on to a friend, as soon as I had finished reading it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Enjoyed the Story
reviews.reviewText: If you can get past the fact that the "treasure hunt" could have been much simpler, less melodramatic, and then resist wondering about all of the ways the whole thing might not have worked as planned, then this book is a wonderful read. I was able to do this. I enjoyed the story and the way it was told. One mystery was easy to figure out eventually; the other one involving Amy's history not so much, and was a little unsatisfactory. In fact if it had turned out as I assumed, then Amy's background could have been much more believable. I thought Quentin Garland's story was wrapped up a little too quickly and suddenly though, as if the author tired of the character and didn't know what to do with him. I still think the book is worth five stars. I look forward to reading more of the author's work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Don't miss this book! I can't praise it enough.
reviews.reviewText: This is as stunning a novel as I've ever read, and I've read novels for fifty years. It amazed me that is Tracy Rees' debut novel. This story is not easy to categorize. It is easy to love and become immersed in. The tale of Amy Snow is a fascinating one. She overcomes a Dickensian childhood replete with neglect and abuse. Amy is always made to feel lesser by almost everyone. The shining exception is her friend and benefactor, Aurelia Vennaway. Aurelia's death sends Amy Snow (who's never been further than the nearest village) on a treasure hunt by train, coach, and carriage. Along the way, Amy Snow learns a vast amount about herself and about Aurelia. Amy discovers friendship, love, and joy. She revisits fear, foreboding, and betrayal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book, intriguing story - bit like a modern day Charles Dickens.

Nonostante la trama ,forse scontata, della ragazza povera che si impone in società e trova l'amore, il romanzo tiene l'interesse con trovate nuove come la caccia al tesoro per scoprire la verità sulla protagonista e descrive in modo abbastanza dettagliato la vita e la società del periodo vittoriano. Lo consiglio a tutti coloro che amano questo periodo e a coloro che amano leggere per rilassarsi e sognare.

Eigentlich lese ich eher weniger solche Romane.beim auspacken dachte ich auch eher an eine “Schnulze“ aber dann konnte ich das Buch nach den ersten Seiten kaum weg legen weil ich wissen wollte wie es mit Amy Snow weiter geht. Der Schreibstil ist schön und die Geschichte berührt einen
Worth to read it. Well written. I love also the main character: Amy Snow. Many references to other classic books by the Brontës, Dickens, Wlikie Collins or even Jane Austen.
Enjoyed the fresh unpredictable story line. Well written, captured my attention from chapter one. Love finding a new author to enjoy.
